briefdescription.para: P-GPS error code: current time unknown.
P-GPS error code: not found but loading in progress.
Value to mark the ephemeris as unavailable for satellites for which no predictions are available from the cloud.

detaileddescription.para: There are currently no P-GPS predictions available.
P-GPS predictions are being loaded from the cloud.
A P-GPS prediction is available now for the current date and time. The prediction pointer in the associated nrf_cloud_pgps_event structure points to the prediction.

A P-GPS request has been created for missing predictions. The event has payload in the form of gps_pgps_request. The event is intended to be used when CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_PGPS_TRANSPORT_MQTT is disabled to let the application decide when and how to use the request information. This event type is not received if CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_PGPS_TRANSPORT_MQTT is enabled.

briefdescription.para: P-GPS event passed to the registered pgps_event_handler.
Event handler registered with the module to handle asynchronous events from the module.

Update storage of the most recent known location, in modem-specific normalized format (int32_t). Current time is also stored. Normalization: (latitude / 90.0) * (1 << 23) (longitude / 360.0) * (1 << 24)

Update the storage of the most recent known location in degrees. This will be injected along with the current time and relevant predicted ephemerides to the GPS unit in order to get the fastest possible fix, when the P-GPS subsystem is built with A-GPS disabled, or when A-GPS data is unavailable due to lack of a cloud connection. Current time is also stored.
If location has previously been set, clear it. The application should do this if significant distances might have been travelled since the previous location was saved.

Update the storage of the leap second offset between GPS time and UTC. This called automatically by the A-GPS subsystem (if enabled) when it receives a UTC assistance element, setting leap_seconds to the delta_tls field.
Schedule a callback when prediction for current time is available. Callback could be immediate, if data already stored in Flash, or later, after loading from the cloud.

simplesect.para: 0 if scheduled successfully, or negative error code if could not send request to cloud.

briefdescription.para: Tries to find an appropriate GPS prediction for the current time.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a pointer to a prediction; the pointer at this pointer will be modified to point to the prediction if the return value is 0. Will be set to NULL on failure.

simplesect.para: 0..NumPredictions-1 if successful; -ETIMEUNKNOWN if current date and time not known; -ETIMEDOUT if all predictions stored are expired; -EINVAL if prediction for the current time is invalid.

briefdescription.para: Requests specified P-GPS data from nRF Cloud via MQTT. Not used for other transports.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to structure specifying what P-GPS data is desired. The request may fail if there no cloud connection; if the specified GPS day and GPS time of day is in the past or more than 2 weeks in the future; if the GPS time of day is larger than 86339; or if the prediction_period_min field is not within the range 120 to 480.
Cloud connection is not established; wait for NRF_CLOUD_EVT_READY.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Requests all available P-GPS data from nRF Cloud via MQTT. Not used for other transports.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, otherwise a (negative) error code.

briefdescription.para: Use this function when you use a custom transport mechanism for downloading prediction data. When your pgps_event_handler_t receives a PGPS_EVT_REQUEST event, send the P-GPS request to the cloud over your transport, then call this function. This function resets the internal state of the library and prepares the flash storage to receive incoming data.

detaileddescription.para: The library calls this automatically for HTTP(S) transports.

parameterdescription.para: No free space in P-GPS flash storage area.

simplesect.para: a negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Call this function when your transport receives a block of prediction data. Prediction data must be received in file order.

detaileddescription.para: The library calls this automatically for HTTP(S) transports.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to P-GPS data received from transport.
Size of P-GPS data chunk received from transport.
Invalid parameter to function or invalid header in P-GPS data received.
Unable to determine current date and time.
No free flash in P-GPS storage area.

simplesect.para: a negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Call this function regardless of whether the download succeeded or failed.

detaileddescription.para: The library calls this automatically for HTTP(S) transports.

For custom transports, the application must call this for transport error, error from a call to nrf_cloud_pgps_process_update(), as well as successful completion. Further, when an error occurs, the application must terminate the transfer.

simplesect.para: a negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: If previous request for P-GPS data failed, re-enable future retries. This should be called by the application after it attempts to handle PGPS_EVT_REQUEST, but is unable to complete it successfully. For example, it should be called if the cloud connection being used to transmit the request is temporarily unavailable.

detaileddescription.para: No need to call when using the MQTT transport.

briefdescription.para: Processes binary P-GPS data received from nRF Cloud over MQTT or REST.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to data received from nRF Cloud.
Buffer size of data to be processed.
An nRF Cloud P-GPS error code was processed.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Injects binary P-GPS data to the modem. If request is NULL, it is assumed that only ephemerides assistance should be injected.

parameterdescription.para: Which assistance elements the modem needs. May be NULL.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, otherwise a (negative) error code.

briefdescription.para: Find out if P-GPS update is in progress.

simplesect.para: True if request sent but loading not yet completed.

briefdescription.para: Download more predictions if less than CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_PGPS_REPLACEMENT_THRESHOLD predictions remain which are still valid.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, otherwise a (negative) error code.

briefdescription.para: Initialize P-GPS subsystem. Validates what is stored, then requests any missing predictions, or full set if expired or missing. When successful, it is ready to provide valid ephemeris predictions.

simplesect.para: It must return successfully before using P-GPS services.
0 if valid or request begun; nonzero on error.

briefdescription.para: Module to provide nRF Cloud Predicted GPS (P-GPS) support to nRF9160 SiP.
